S.FORM: iŋga acham pekŋa lɔˀraŋŋaŋ ambasi ammasi mɛttuŋsiŋ.
S.TRANSL: "I'm going to Assam," I told my parents.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ pegaŋ — pegaŋ pus məŋsir — məŋsir teis gəte thaasiŋ pegaŋaŋ yammu akkhɛn sat dinlɛ — sat dinlɛ siliguɖi lɔːndigɛ.
S.TRANSL: And I went — in Paus or Mangsir — the 23d of Mangsir I started out and after some 7 days I got to Siliguri [railway station in West Bengal].

S.FORM: khɔtmunu relɛtmu ʈikəʈ khɔktumbɛaŋ na phərkətin lɔːndigɛ dui dinlɛ.
S.TRANSL: From there we took rail tickets and after two days we arrived in Pharkatin.

S.FORM: dui dinlɛ lɔːndigɛaŋ anigɛ na merapani lɔːndigɛ khɔtmunu kam hɔksumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then we got to Merapani and from there we looked for work.

S.FORM: kam hɔksumbɛaŋ kɔ na ara dulai cokma khosumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We got work sawing wood.

S.FORM: khosumbɛaŋ kɔ — ãã — khɔmbhɛaŋ ara dulai coksɛ tho nãga hil lasigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We went into the Naga Hills to saw wood.

S.FORM: lasigɛaŋ kɔ khɔmbha kam cogigɛ — cogigɛ taːndi khɔmbhɛaŋ məhina thik yagigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We worked there for a month.

S.FORM: məhina thik yagigɛaŋ kɔ yagigɛaŋ taːndi pəisa məhinəvari tələb mɛbɛrigɛ.
S.TRANSL: After we were there a month they paid us our salary.

S.FORM: mɛbɛrigɛaŋ kɔ hatmunu taːndi yammu lɔːndigɛ.
S.TRANSL: They paid us and we came out from there.

S.FORM: lɔːndigɛaŋ yammu lam tɔm'ɛtmu lasigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We came out and got into digging roads.

S.FORM: lam tɔyumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We dug the road.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ lammɛtmu məhina thik yagigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We kept working a month on the road.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ lammɛn tɔyum surumbɛaŋ khɔtmunu yammu pəisa mɛbɛrigɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then we finished digging the road and they gave us the money for that.

S.FORM: mɛbɛrigɛaŋ yammu khɔtmu sɔpma yagigɛ pəisa mɛbɛrigɛaŋ tho mekləjəŋ pegigɛ.
S.TRANSL: They paid us, and we stayed there a bit, and we went up to Meklayang.

S.FORM: mekləjəŋ pegigɛaŋ kɔ ambhu kancha thik yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: One of my cousins stayed there.

S.FORM: ambhu yuŋɛaŋ kɔ khɔtmu phaˀruŋsiŋ kam niyaːn — pəndrə din the yaˀ letma phaˀruŋsiŋ.
S.TRANSL: I helped them a couple days — for about fifteen days I helped them transplant rice.

S.FORM: yaˀ lettum surumbɛ.
S.TRANSL: We finished transplanting the rice.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ yammu adzum thiknu tho nãga hil pesigɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then with a friend of mine we went up to the Naga Hills.

S.FORM: tho pesigɛaŋ kɔ yammu rəksi yususigɛ ɛmbhɛdaŋba khola thikkɛtmu.
S.TRANSL: We went up there and distilled liquor in a valley.

S.FORM: rəksi yususigɛ. yususigɛ. khɔmbhɛaŋ bərkhə bhər rəksi yususigɛ pãc chə məhina.
S.TRANSL: We distilled liquor all summer — five or six months.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kha rəksin sɛndik yuma poŋ.
S.TRANSL: The liquor had to be distilled at night.

S.FORM: sɛndik yumaŋ kɔ yammu bihandik sɛndiksa na lainɛtmu sam'na tham'naba.
S.TRANSL: After distilling it, in the morning, while it was still dark, we'd take it over to the barracks.

S.FORM: khɔmbha pəisa ambi.
S.TRANSL: The gave us money.

S.FORM: ambiaŋ yammu phɛtmunayaŋ kɔ yammu bəjarɛtmu pekmaŋ kɔ gũɖ iŋma poksɛ — miʈhai.
S.TRANSL: They gave us money and we'd bring it and go to the bazaar and we had to buy molasses — sweet stuff.

S.FORM: miʈhai iŋmunayaŋ kɔ thakmaŋ kɔ yammu ʈinɛtmu pas cokma poksɛ.
S.TRANSL: We bought molasses and brought it up and again we put it to ferment in a tin.

S.FORM: pas cokmaŋ kɔ khɔtmunu sat dinlɛ yuma poŋ rəksin.
S.TRANSL: We put it to ferment and from there, after seven days, the liquor had to be distilled.

S.FORM: rəksi yumaŋ kɔ khɔmbhɛaŋ sat dinlɛ yammu yuma poksɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then again the liquor [a new batch] had to be distilled after seven days.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ yammu lainɛtmu sama poksɛ.
S.TRANSL: Then again it had to be delivered to the barracks.

S.FORM: khɔmbha kam coguŋŋaŋ ʈinlɛ — ʈin thiklɛ kumɛn əsi rupiyarɔt nɛssɛ kumɛnnɛn cəĩ.
S.TRANSL: When I worked, the price was only 80 rupees per tin — for one tin.

S.FORM: əsi rupiya nɛssɛ.
S.TRANSL: It was 80 rupees.

S.FORM: əsi rupiya nɛssɛ. taːndi —
S.TRANSL: It was 80 rupees. The later —

S.FORM: bərkhə — wayɛsigɛ adzummɛnnu wayɛsigɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ thaŋ nãga hilɛ pe —
S.TRANSL: In summer — we two were there, me and my friend, and then we went up in the Naga Hills.

S.FORM: yammu pesigɛaŋ kɔ nãganu kam cogigɛ ?? kam cogigɛ waːttigɛaŋ taːndi —
S.TRANSL: Again we went and worked with the Nagas. We were working and then later —

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ nãgahaˀrɛ khunchi yaˀ lettumbɛ waːttumbɛaŋ taːndi nãgarɛ khunchi kam mɛsuru.
S.TRANSL: We stayed on transplanting the Nagas' rice, and the Nagas finished their work.

S.FORM: mɛsuru mɛwaːttuaŋ kɔ ɛtyo y'yɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: When they had finished, we came back down.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ andhɛba mɛtmunaba thik wayɛ.
S.TRANSL: There was a person who was said to be my grandfather.

S.FORM: khɔ andh'banu sorik wayɛsigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We stayed together with that grandfather.

S.FORM: wayɛsigɛaŋ kɔ kam thedhe cogusigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We did some work.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ taːndik ɛtnanu khəbər phɛrɛ — ambarɛ khəbər haŋu phɛnchu — ciʈʈhi haŋu phɛnchu.
S.TRANSL: Then later news came from over here [in Nepal] — my father sent news — he sent a letter.

S.FORM: ciʈʈhi haŋuaŋ kɔ "hara himmu t'yɛ pegɛ kɛmmaŋ sallik tuk" pha mɛbaːttu.
S.TRANSL: He sent a letter saying, "Come home quickly, your mother is seriously ill."

S.FORM: ciʈʈhi khɔmbha mɛsaptu.
S.TRANSL: He wrote a letter like that.

S.FORM: tərə khɔmbhasaŋ iŋga mɛmbhɛnba.
S.TRANSL: But even so I didn't come.

S.FORM: iŋga taːndi yagaŋ yagaŋ khɔmbhɛaŋ nãga hil yagaŋ nãga hilnu lɔːndaŋŋaŋ kɔ yammu yo bəɖhapəʈʈhəra mɛtmunab'ɛtmu yammu yo pegaŋ ara hɛksɛ.
S.TRANSL: I stayed on, and then I stayed in the Naga Hills, and then I came out from the Naga Hills and again went down to saw wood at Barhapatthara.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛ ara lɛːbuŋ hɛguŋ hɛguŋ. taːndi —
S.TRANSL: I sawed wood. Then later —

S.FORM: taːndi kɔ akkhɛn chə məhina ara lɛːbuŋ.
S.TRANSL: Later — I sawed wood for some six months.

S.FORM: lɛːbuŋŋaŋ kɔ khɔn ara lɛːbuŋb'ɛn pəisan mɛmbɛraŋŋɛn.
S.TRANSL: I sawed, and they didn't pay me for it.

S.FORM: kubhɛrɛklɔt mɛbɛraŋ.
S.TRANSL: They only paid me half.

S.FORM: kubhɛrɛk mɛbɛraŋŋɛn kɔ hɔmbhɛaŋ taːndi kɔ amba s'yɛ rətchə ɛtna cəubis sal.
S.TRANSL: They paid me half, and then later it turned out that my father had died over here [in Nepal], in 1967.

S.FORM: cəubis sallɛ jeʈhə'llɛ s'yɛ rətchə tərə iŋga khɔmbhasaŋ pətyaro mɛndzokpa amba s'yɛ pha mɛndzokpa.
S.TRANSL: He died in Jeth (May-June), but I didn't believe it at the time.

S.FORM: taːndi — jeʈhə'llɛ s'yɛ məŋsirɛllɛ kam mɛdzogu mɛdesu pusɛllɛ ciʈʈhi mɛhaŋu mɛbhɛnchu.
S.TRANSL: He died in Jeth and they did the ceremonies in the autumn and sent a letter in winter.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ ciʈʈhi mɛhaŋuaŋ kɔ iŋga khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ alla s'yɛ rətchə phɛaŋ kɔ hoitlɔrik thaasiŋ phɛraŋ.
S.TRANSL: When they sent the letter I realized that he had died and I immediately set out and came.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ phɛraŋaŋ kɔ himmu t'yaŋ.
S.TRANSL: I came and arrived home.

S.FORM: t'yaŋaŋ pəisaŋ mɛndaːppa.
S.TRANSL: I didn't even bring money.

S.FORM: mɛndabayaŋ kɔ taːndik khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ mɛndzo suddhə cokŋasiŋ adhɛgekkɛn suyuŋ.
S.TRANSL: I purified myself and shaved my head.

S.FORM: alla pəhile thɛgekkɛn mɛnchuɛ himmu tama mɛnnuˀmuna
S.TRANSL: It wouldn't do to arrive home without having shaved my head.

S.FORM: yo yapmi him thikkɛtmu t'yaŋ.
S.TRANSL: I arrived down at someone's house.

S.FORM: yapmi him thikkɛtmu t'yaŋŋaŋ adhɛgekkɛn suyuŋ.
S.TRANSL: I shaved my head there.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ caŋ lɛkŋasiŋŋaŋ himmu t'yaŋ khɔmbhɛ car dinlɛ mɛndzo yum nɛttuŋaŋ kɔ iŋga apalo kam suruŋ.
S.TRANSL: Then I changed my clothes and arrived home, and I abstained from salt for four days, and I too finished mourning in turn.
